instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2879: What is 820-2879? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PPVCORE_S0_CPU: What is PPVCORE_S0_CPU? This is the primary power rail for the CPU that powers the CPU, known as CPU vcore. Without this, the machine will be braindead. .
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Green light, quarter fan spin
threads.message:
Hello,


I got this logic board <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>. No signs of water damage. I get a green light. When shorting power pads I get a quarter fan spin and <SIGNAL>PPVCORE_S0_CPU</SIGNAL> pulses for a blink at about 0.9V.


<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> is 12.56V. What should I measure next?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Green light, quarter fan spin
threads.message: <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>, resistance on pins 17/18 and 27/28 is 4.5Ohm and 20.9Ohm respectively.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Green light, quarter fan spin
threads.message: Any history to this thing? Without any this will be a time waster.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Green light, quarter fan spin
threads.message: No water damage, but no history available... Should I ultrasonic it and give it another go before I throw it away?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Green light, quarter fan spin
threads.message: Yeah, there isn't much else you can do with these antiques.
